com.blockwithme.util.shared.annotations

Annotation Type KVMap


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface KVMap
    KVMap is a generic annotation that can be applied to anything, and represents a map of key-value pairs. Due to the limitations of Java annotations, in particular, the lack of inheritance and polymorphism, The only supported type that can be used to represent anything is the String. So keys and values will be Strings. This can give us a terse syntax. We can simply model the map entries as an array of Strings. The first String is the key, and the rest are values. Therefore, a value could itself be an array, or we could even have no value at all. One problem is that an empty array is also valid, such that we would have no key either. Such array would be ignored. If we had limited ourselves to exactly one value per key, we could have just used a single String[] for both keyes and values, but that would have been very error prone. So each key-value pair must be itself an annotation. To maximize the flexibility, we allow the content of the values to be interpreted as Groovy source code.
    Author:
    monster

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      E[] value
